title: How To Use CGMissingDataR
text: CGMissingDataR R package based CGMissingData Python library evaluating model performance feature missingness : injecting missing values feature columns specified masking rates, imputing missing values using Multiple Imputation Chained Equations (MICE)-style iterative imputer, training Random Forest k-Nearest Neighbors regressors report Mean ABsolute Percentage Error (MAPE) R across missingness levels.

title: How To Use CGMissingDataR
text: installation, ensure following R packages installed: Install development version CGMissingDataR GitHub:

title: How To Use CGMissingDataR
text: brief example illustrating usage CGMissingDataR.
code: library(CGMissingDataR)  # Load example dataset data("CGMExampleData") results <- run_missingness_benchmark(CGMExampleData, mask_rates = c(0.05, 0.10, 0.15, 0.20),target_col = "LBORRES", # Running the missingness benchmark feature_cols = c("TimeDifferenceMinutes", "TimeSeries", "USUBJID"))  #> Warning: Number of logged events: 1 #> Warning: Number of logged events: 1 #> Warning: Number of logged events: 1 #> Warning: Number of logged events: 1 print(results) # Displaying the results #>   MaskRate         Model      MAPE        R2 #> 1       5% Random Forest  7.497932 0.7418421 #> 2       5%           kNN  7.898898 0.7276014 #> 3      10% Random Forest  8.510749 0.6683246 #> 4      10%           kNN  9.143478 0.6315460 #> 5      15% Random Forest  9.758954 0.5598508 #> 6      15%           kNN 10.345550 0.5201831 #> 7      20% Random Forest 10.189505 0.5363248 #> 8      20%           kNN 10.772825 0.4916150

code: @Manual{,   title = {CGMissingDataR: Missingness Benchmark (MICE Imputation, Random Forest, kNN)},   author = {Shubh Saraswat and {Hasin Shahed Shad} and Xiaohua Douglas Zhang},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/saraswatsh/CGMissingDataR}, }

title: Welcome to CGMissingDataR
text: CGMissingDataR R package based CGMissingData Python library evaluating model performance feature missingness : injecting missing values feature columns specified masking rates, imputing missing values using Multiple Imputation Chained Equations (MICE)-style iterative imputer, training Random Forest k-Nearest Neighbors regressors report Mean ABsolute Percentage Error (MAPE) R across missingness levels. installation, ensure following R packages installed: Install development version CGMissingDataR GitHub:

title: Welcome to CGMissingDataR
text: brief vignette illustrating usage CGMissingDataR can found .

title: Welcome to CGMissingDataR
text: changelog available .

title: Example dataset for CGMissingData — CGMExampleData
text: small synthetic dataset intended examples tests run_missingness_benchmark().

title: Example dataset for CGMissingData — CGMExampleData
text: data frame 250 rows 6 variables: LBORRES Laboratory Observed Result Glucose (numeric). TimeSeries Numeric feature representing time series data. TimeDifferenceMinutes Time difference minutes measurements (numeric). USUBJID Numeric subject identifier. SiteID Site identifier (character). Visit Visit label (character).

what: CGMissingDataR: Missingness Benchmark (MICE Imputation, Random Forest, kNN) — CGMissingDataR-package
title: CGMissingDataR: Missingness Benchmark (MICE Imputation, Random Forest, kNN) — CGMissingDataR-package
text: Evaluates predictive performance feature-level missingness repeated-measures continuous glucose monitoring-like data. benchmark injects missing values user-specified rates, imputes incomplete feature matrices using iterative chained-equations approach inspired multivariate imputation chained equations (MICE) (Melissa J. Azur, Elizabeth . Stuart, Constantine Frangakis Philip J. Leaf (2011) doi:10.1002/mpr.329 ), fits Random Forest regression models (Leo Breiman (2001) doi:10.1023/:1010933404324 ) k-nearest-neighbor regression models (Zhongheng Zhang (2016) doi:10.21037/atm.2016.03.37 ), reports mean absolute percentage error (MAPE) R-squared (R2) across missingness rates.

title: CGMissingDataR: Missingness Benchmark (MICE Imputation, Random Forest, kNN) — CGMissingDataR-package
text: Maintainer: Shubh Saraswat shubh.saraswat00@gmail.com (ORCID) [copyright holder] Authors: Hasin Shahed Shad hasin.shad@uky.edu Xiaohua Douglas Zhang douglas.zhang@uky.edu (ORCID)

title: Run missingness benchmark — run_missingness_benchmark
text: Benchmarks model performance feature missingness. function: Filters complete cases target_col feature_cols (baseline complete data), Splits training/validation, Masks feature values rate using Bernoulli (cell-wise) missingness, Imputes missing features using MICE training data applies fitted imputation model validation data via mice::mice.mids(newdata = ...) (reduces leakage), Trains Random Forest (ranger) kNN regression (FNN::knn.reg), Returns MAPE R-squared model mask rate. Feature columns must numeric (coercible numeric without introducing new missing values). mirrors workflows features treated numeric arrays.

title: Run missingness benchmark — run_missingness_benchmark
code: run_missingness_benchmark(   data,   target_col,   feature_cols = NULL,   mask_rates = c(0.05, 0.1, 0.2, 0.3),   rf_n_estimators = 200,   knn_k = 5,   test_size = 0.2,   seed = 42 )

title: Run missingness benchmark — run_missingness_benchmark
text: data data.frame (object coercible data.frame) containing dataset. target_col Single character string: name outcome column. feature_cols Character vector feature column names. NULL, uses columns except target_col. mask_rates Numeric vector (0, 1): proportion feature entries mask per rate. rf_n_estimators Integer: number trees random forest. knn_k Integer: number neighbors kNN regression. test_size Numeric (0, 1): fraction rows assigned validation split. seed Integer: seed data split model reproducibility.

title: Run missingness benchmark — run_missingness_benchmark
text: data.frame columns MaskRate, Model, MAPE, R2.

title: Run missingness benchmark — run_missingness_benchmark
text: Validation imputation performed using mice::mice.mids(newdata = ...), generates imputations new data according model stored training mids object. MAPE computed using Metrics::mape() non-zero targets avoid instability actual values zero.

title: Run missingness benchmark — run_missingness_benchmark
text: Shubh Saraswat, Hasin Shahed Shad, Xiaohua Douglas Zhang

title: Run missingness benchmark — run_missingness_benchmark
code: data("CGMExampleData") run_missingness_benchmark(   CGMExampleData,   target_col = "LBORRES",   feature_cols = c("TimeDifferenceMinutes", "TimeSeries", "USUBJID"),   mask_rates = c(0.05, 0.10) ) #> Warning: Number of logged events: 1 #> Warning: Number of logged events: 1 #>   MaskRate         Model     MAPE        R2 #> 1       5% Random Forest 7.497932 0.7418421 #> 2       5%           kNN 7.898898 0.7276014 #> 3      10% Random Forest 8.510749 0.6683246 #> 4      10%           kNN 9.143478 0.6315460

title: CGMissingDataR 0.0.1
text: Initial package creation preparing CRAN submission.
